snippet: Documents and artifacts from Luis F. Emilio, a white officer from Massachusetts who led a black regiment during the Civil War, are going on sale.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column notes forgotten archives related to black Civil War soldiers that are coming on the market, paintings by 19th-century folk artists Ruth and Samuel Shute that will be sold at Sotheby's and Brooklyn Historical Society's exhibition Brooklyn Abolitionists/In Pursuit of Freedom.
lead_paragraph: Documents and artifacts from Luis F. Emilio, a white officer from Massachusetts who led a black regiment during the Civil War, are going on sale.

headline.main: Civil War Archive to Go on Sale
headline.print_headline: Civil War Archive to Go on Sale
